posts.post_title: FS: t206 HOF, SL, rare back, SGC 60-70
posts.post_content:
For sale:

Following cards available. My apologies as scans do not do them justice, I can try to rescan and send via e-mail if anyone is interested.

Check, MO or paypal gift please.

thanks - Rob
[url]rgutheil@gmail.com[/url]

George Davis, HOF, EPDG - SGC 70 - SOLD

Rube Marquard, HOF, Old Mill - SGC 70 - SOLD

Sam Crawford, HOF - SGC 60 - $350

Frank Chance, HOf, Yellow port - SGC 60 - $390
rare back?  where?
enail sent on sid smith....
PM sent as well. Thanks.
I consider EPDG a rare back, apparently you dont...?
Rob- I would be good with Sid Smith at $350....thanks

here are the SLers:
both SOLD

[quote name="Leon" post=1003815]rare back?  where?[/QUOTE]

Leon, that's a great idea for one of your poll questions, "which do you consider to be a T206 'rare back' (check all that apply) and why?"

[quote name="trobba" post=1003830]I consider EPDG a rare back, apparently you dont...?[/QUOTE]

T206Resource ranks it #20 out of 39 *(including Cobb back). Since it's not even in the top 50% of backs, no, I wouldn't consider it rare. However if you do, it's certainly your right to. I thought maybe you had something else with a true rare back for sale?  (one at least being in the more scarce 50 percentile)

I don't want to turn this thread into a discussion, but....

EPDG is definitely a tougher back...only a handful on Ebay right now and people pay a premium for them.  Really it depends on how you define "rare", but I certainly would not downplay EPDG as a common back.  Maybe call it a mildly rare back???  So I think the OP is correct in his assessment :)

Nice cards, Rob.

For those of you who have not bought from Rob, he's top shelf.

Good luck with the sales.
My last post in this thread is that I should add that I have had great dealings with Rob (Trobba) over the years. No worries and a great collector.

Leon,

I thought the same thinG:D  I was looking for at least a piedy 42, or better....my heart palps a little when i see rare backs or freaks....

All due respect i'm sure seller great guy, but i have to agree with Leon...epdg is tufer, but not "rare"

:)

G'day Mates
I'm more inclined to think rare is something you see less than 5 out of 100 cards as opposed to ranking.

[quote name="mrvster" post=1003951]Leon,

I thought the same thinG:D  I was looking for at least a piedy 42, or better....my heart palps a little when i see rare backs or freaks....

All due respect i'm sure seller great guy, but i have to agree with Leon...epdg is tufer, but not "rare"

:)

G'day Mates[/QUOTE]

Piedmont 42 would be considered scarce like broadleaf...not rare :D

I agree with Jon, we have no way of knowing the rarity from the ranks...just which is tougher and more scarce.

mike!!!

touche!!:)  lenox and beyond!!rare;)

Totally inpropriate, IMHO, to challenge EPDG as a rare back in this thread.  If you want to debate those merits, save it for the main forum.  This seller has some terrific T206s for sale -- that should be the only thing worth discussing here.
I think the reason it has merit is because it was presumably used to draw eyes to the listing. Since that's the purpose, the validity of the claim is fair game.

In my honest opinion, epdg backs are not rare, but somewhat uncommon. I have a card available if someone wants the best of both worlds ( low pop., and epdg back) psa 6 rebel oakes...Where are the Master set collectors when you need them??

Seller is awesome guy no doubt.....point well taken should be discussed on main board Paul:)....but at least more "bumps" mike;) maybe a few more eyes and more exposure for Mike....

Jay is right also, when you hear "rare" backs, can't click fast enuf to thread only wanting more when u find out they or it is just "tufer":D....like a little dissapointing.....:o


NEVER MIND THIS RUBBISH GOVENAR!!!!ON WITH THE SALE AND GOOD LUCK;)

My appologies if i hijacked this sale...


Peace

V
Email sent on sgc 70 marquard.....
